meanings.definition: A hymn or psalm sung at the beginning of a Christian religious service.
meanings.sent1: The introit filled the church with beautiful music.
meanings.sent2: The choir sang the introit as the congregation gathered.
meanings.sent3: The introit was so catchy that everyone hummed it all day.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared like an introit, lifting spirits high.
meanings.sent5: The introit echoed through the halls, creating a serene atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The opening section of a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The introit of the symphony set the tone for the entire piece.
meanings.sent2: As the pianist played the introit, the audience was captivated.
meanings.sent3: The introit of the song was like a warm embrace to the ears.
meanings.sent4: His guitar solo served as the introit to the rock concert.
meanings.sent5: The introit of the opera was hauntingly beautiful, drawing in the listeners.
